::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**FM1.1 Deepwater coastal inlets**](/efg-info/FM1_1.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/FM1_1_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: FM1.1.web.map v1.0.

> Known locations of fjords where selected from a global geographical gazetteer (GeoNames 2020) and the composite gazetteer of Antarctica (SCAR 1992-2020). We further selected related coastal areas from a global coastal typology (Type IV in Dürr et al. 2011) and the adjacent marine shelves to 2000 meter depth (Becker et al 2009). A composite map was created at 30 arc seconds spatial resolution in geographic projection, occurrences were then aggregated to half degree spatial resolution and reclassified as major occurrences (cells with at least one known occurrence) and minor occurrences (cells with > 5% occurrence of coastal/marine shelf areas). Minor occurrences were clipped to a 10km buffer along the coast to remove inland and oceanic areas.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**Coastal-Typology-2011** (Durr et al 2011):

Source of _topography and geomorphology_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

 **GeoNames-2020** (GeoNames 2020):

Source of _known geographical features_.
 Resolution: variable (points), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: known records.

 **SCAR-gazetteer-2020** (SCAR 1992):

Source of _known geographical features_.
 Resolution: variable (points), NA.
 Accuracy evaluation: known records.

 **SRTM30-PLUS-V11** (Becker et al. 2009):

Source of _topography and geomorphology_.
 Resolution: ca. 1km2, static.
 Accuracy evaluation: quantitative (variable).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}

:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Thresholds* :: *Clipping* :: *Selection* :: *Buffering*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Direct,specific*.

Ground observations are _indirect_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Known records,documented,quantitative*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: FM1.1.IM.alt**, version v3.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: FM1.1.web.map**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**FM1.1.IM.alt** (v3.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/FM1.1.IM.alt_v3.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**FM1.1.web.map** (v1.0): [GitHub repository](FM1.1.web.map_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/FM1.1.web.map_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091013){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.FM1_1_web_map){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](layers/FM1.1.web.map_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.
